page.title: 18Youth Clubs: Pateley
page.content: The Youth Club in Pateley is run by three paid adult leaders and two voluntary helpers. It is attended by young people between the ages of fifteen and twenty years. Usually between fifty and seventy people attend each week. They pay Â£1 per year for membership and 20p per session.Non members pay 25p per session. There are three rooms for their use. These were the craft rooms of the former secondary school. The Club offers table-tennis, darts, pool and also has a colour television. The members organise discos and often play five-a- side football at the Sports Centre. Craftwork is another activity offered to the young people. There is also a dark room where they are about to start doing photography. The Club is open every Monday, Tuesday and Thursday evening from 7.30pm to 10pm.
